entry.title: 2020 Year in Review
entry.content:
As promised, we have published our Year in SETI Research Review issue of SETI.news. In total we gathered 71 articles featuring new scholarly work in the technosignature field from 2020.

A huge thnaks goes out to Julia LaFond and Jason Wright for gathering the articles from ADS.

Check out the latest edition of SETI.news!

entry.title: We're Back!
entry.content:
Hello SETI.news fans! We had a couple mailings in 2019 of the newsletter, and some catch-up issues in early 2020, but ran in to 2 problems:

1) the scripts to generate and update this website broke in late 2018, and

2) the administrator ran out of time to fix the website or update the newsletter for much of 2019 and 2020 for… lots of reasons.

So welcome back - Take a look at all the back-issues of the newsletter here!

We hope SETI.news will be back to regular monthly operations in 2021, and are collaborating with Jason Wright’s group and their SETI ADS Library to make curating this site easier for all! Part of that effort is fixing and re-launching this website version. Please let me know if there are any issues.

entry.title: 2018 FEB and MAR Mailing
entry.content:
The 2018 February and March combined mailing of SETI.news is out. Read it here!

The SETI.news research newsletter has now reached over 200 subscribers! Thank you all for reading, and be sure to submit any new articles you find/write or that we’ve missed!

entry.title: 2018 JAN Mailing
entry.content:
The 2018 January mailing of SETI.news is out. Read it here!

This is the 3rd birthday for SETI.news (started Jan 2016)! Thank you all for your support, and keep contributing to our newsletter!

entry.title: 2017 JUNE and JULY Mailing
entry.content:
The 2017 June & July mailing of SETI.news is out!

This issue is extra-full, with 15 articles spanning a huge range of topics! Enjoy, and be sure to keep submitting articles you find using the Submit a Paper link!

entry.title: 2017 APRIL Mailing
entry.content: The 2017 April mailing of SETI.news is out!

entry.title: 2017 MAR Mailing
entry.content:
The 2017 March mailing of SETI.news is out!

The email list has now reached 70 subscribers!

Note: “April Fools” articles related to SETI will not be included in the email newsletter. However, I will note the one that caught my attention this year: A revolution is brewing: observations of TRAPPIST-1 exoplanetary system fosters a new biomarker, and shamelessly link to my 2013 semi-serious April Fools paper: Unidentified Moving Objects in Next Generation Time Domain Surveys

entry.title: 2017 FEB Mailing
entry.content:
The 2017 February mailing of SETI.news is out!

If you see any SETI articles we missed posting this year (perhaps ones that didn’t get listed on the arXiv), please let us know by reaching out to J. Davenport.

entry.title: 2017 JAN Mailing
entry.content: The 2017 January mailing of SETI.news is out!

entry.title: 2016 DEC Mailing
entry.content:
The 2016 December mailing of SETI.news is out!

This marks 1 full year of mailings from SETI.news! The list has grown to nearly 60 subscribers.

The biggest conversation for SETI research this year was the discovery of unexplained variability from KIC 8462852, also known as “Boyajian’s Star”, first announced in 2015. We expect much more interest in this object, and searches for similar outliers in large surveys, in 2017!

If you see any SETI articles we missed posting this year (perhaps ones that didn’t get listed on the arXiv), please let us know by reaching out to J. Davenport.

entry.title: 2016 MAY Mailing
entry.content:
The 2016 May mailing of SETI.news is out! View this mailing


Fun fact: The most popular article from last month’s mailing was: “Type III Societies (Apparently) Do Not Exist” (B. Lacki)

The newsletter is slowly growing in readership. Please help spread the word and post about SETI.news on your social media platforms. This will ensure we meet our 2 primary goals:

  1. Get submissions/records of all new SETI research
  2. Spread the word about academic SETI research to all interested researchers

entry.title: Welcome to SETI.news
entry.content:
We are starting this website/monthly email list to help disseminate recent academic research on the Search for Extra Terrestrial Intelligence (SETI). This will only include academic articles or blog posts with relevant observations or testable theory related to SETI. Note this doesn’t include general astrobiology, as there are now multiple appropriate research journals devoted to that topic. Spam, abject speculation, hoaxes, and conspiracy theory will not be included.

If you are interested in staying up to date with the latest SETI research, sign up for the email list!

If you are writing a research paper or article on a SETI topic, please submit it for our monthly mailing!

entry.title: Articles from 2010
entry.content:
Here are a bunch of SETI articles from 2010:

  • A Failure of Serendipity: the Square Kilometre Array will struggle to eavesdrop on Human-like ETI
  • Starry Messages: Searching for Signatures of Interstellar Archaeology
  • How can we distinguish transient pulsars from SETI beacons?
  • The Entropy Principle and the Influence of Sociological Pressures on SETI
  • New SETI: Broader Searches for Signatures on Intelligence
  • Candidate Identification and Interference Removal in SETI@home
  • Geometrical joke(r?)s for SETI

entry.title: Articles from 1999-2009
entry.content:
Here are a bunch of SETI articles from 1999-2009 (in no particular order):

  • The Use of Gamma-ray Bursts as Direction and Time Markers in SETI Strategies
  • Persistence solves Fermi Paradox but challenges SETI projects
  • Limits from CGRO/EGRET Data on the Use of Antimatter as a Power Source by Extraterrestrial Civilizations
  • Megachannel Extraterrestrial Assay Candidates: No Transmissions from Intrinsically Steady Sources
  • Synchronized SETI - The Case for “Opposition”
  • Forecast for the Next Eon: Applied Cosmology and the Long-Term Fate of Intelligent Beings
  • The Temporal Aspect of the Drake Equation and SETI
  • Cosmic Irony: SETI Optimism from Catastrophes?
  • “Permanence” - An Adaptationist Solution to Fermi’s Paradox?
  • Galactic Gradients, Postbiological Evolution and the Apparent Failure of SETI
  • Optical SETI with Imaging Cherenkov Telescopes
  • Macroengineering in the Galactic Context: A New Agenda for Astrobiology
  • A new empirical approach in the Search for Extraterrestrial Intelligence: Astrobiological nonlocality at the cosmological level
  • Counting on Beauty: The role of aesthetic, ethical, and physical universal principles for interstellar communication
  • New SETI Sky Surveys for Radio Pulses
  • Testing SETI Message Designs
  • The Allen Telescope Array: The First Widefield, Panchromatic, Snapshot Radio Camera for Radio Astronomy and SETI
  • Some Comments on Possible Preferred Directions for the SETI Search
  • Broadcasting but not receiving: density dependence considerations for SETI signals
  • How Rare Are Extraterrestrial Civilizations and When Did They Emerge?
  • The Galactic Habitable Zone and the Age Distribution of Complex Life in the Milky Way
  • Searches for Fast Radio Transients
  • Searching for Cost Optimized Interstellar Beacons
  • Messaging with Cost Optimized Interstellar Beacons
  • The Allen Telescope Array: The First Widefield, Panchromatic, Snapshot Radio Camera for Radio Astronomy and SETI
  • Messaging to Extra-Terrestrial Intelligence
  • The SETI Paradox
  • Megachannel Extraterrestrial Assay Candidates: No Transmissions from Intrinsically Steady Sources
  • Target Selection for SETI: 1. A Catalog of Nearby Habitable Stellar Systems
  • Sending and Searching for Interstellar Messages
  • Eavesdropping on Radio Broadcasts from Galactic Civilizations with Upcoming Observatories for Redshifted 21cm Radiation

entry.title: Classic Articles
entry.content:
Prof. Jason Wright has a nice ADS library that includes many classic (and recent) SETI papers

Here are some “classic” articles on SETI.

This is not a complete or comprehensive list…

  • Searching for Interstellar Communications
  • Search for Artificial Stellar Sources of Infrared Radiation
  • Communications from Superior Galactic Communities
  • Search for Artificial Stellar Sources of Infrared Radiation
  • Interstellar and Interplanetary Communication by Optical Masers
  • Direct contact among galactic civilizations by relativistic interstellar spaceflight
  • Transmission of Information by Extraterrestrial Civilizations.
  • The Infrared Detectability of Dyson Civilizations
  • Interstellar Radio Communication and the Frequency Selection Problem
  • On the Detectivity of Advanced Galactic Civilizations
  • The Zoo Hypothesis
  • The Search for Signals from Extraterrestrial Civilizations
  • The search for extraterrestrial intelligence
  • Explanation for the Absence of Extraterrestrials on Earth
  • Project Ozma II - Astronomers renew the search for CETI signals from space
  • Broadcast strategies in the galaxy - A principal message source locale
  • Eavesdropping - The radio signature of the earth
  • Interstellar probes - A new approach to SETI
  • The Great Silence - the Controversy Concerning Extraterrestrial Intelligent Life
  • Scintillation-induced Intermittency in SETI
  • The Search for Extraterrestrial Intelligence (SETI) 2001
  • Project Ozma: The Birth of Observational SETI
